quotes.quote: Every general prohibition creates its bootleggers.
Regardless of what one's attitude towards prohibition may be, temperance is something against which, at a time of war, no reasonable protest can be made.
Prohibition makes you want to cry into your beer and denies you the beer to cry into.
We find many things to which the prohibition of them constitutes the only temptation.
Prohibition has made nothing but trouble.
Prohibitions create the desire they were intended to cure.
Prohibition only drives drunkenness behind doors and into dark places, and does not cure it or even diminish it.
Prohibition was introduced as a fraud; it has been nursed as a fraud.
Prohibition is an attempted cure that makes matters worse - for both the addict and the rest of us.
Alcohol didn't cause the high crime rates of the '20s and '30s, Prohibition did. And drugs do not cause today's alarming crime rates, but drug prohibition does.
Complete prohibition of all chemical mind changers can be decreed, but cannot be enforced, and tends to create more evils than it cures.
Prohibition is a hard sounding word, worthless as a rallying cry, hard as a locked door or going to bed without your supper.
Prohibition didn't work in the Garden of Eden. Adam ate the apple.
The prohibition of drugs causes crime. You don't have to legalize, just decriminalize it.
Prohibition is better than no liquor at all.
The prohibition law, written for weaklings and derelicts, has divided the nation, like Gaul, into three parts - wets, drys and hypocrites.
Making prohibition work is like making water run uphill; it's against nature.
The more prohibitions you have, the less virtuous people will be. The more weapons you have, the less secure people will be. The more subsidies you have, the less self reliant people will be.
Prohibition may be a disputed theory, but none can say that it doesn't hold water.

Prohibition is an awful flop. We like it. It can't stop what it's meant to stop. We like it. It's left a trail of graft and slime It don't prohibit worth a dime It's filled our land with vice and crime, Nevertheless, we're for it.
Prohibition is the trigger of crime.

Prohibition will work great injury to the cause of temperance. It is a species of intemperance within itself, for it goes beyond the bounds of reason in that it attempts to control a man's appetite by legislation, and makes a crime out of things that are not crimes. A Prohibition law strikes a blow at the very principles upon which our government was founded.
Prohibition goes beyond the bounds of reason in that it attempts to control a man's appetite by legislation and makes crimes out of things that are not crimes.
One role of prohibition is in making the drug market more lucrative.

Prohibition... goes beyond the bounds of reason in that it attempts to control a man's appetite by legislation and makes a crime out of things that are not crimes... A prohibition law strikes a blow at the very principles upon which our government was founded.
Prohibition doesn't work, and again, they've put the evidence right there showing that responsible regulation has hugely reduced cigarette use.
For every prohibition you create, you also create an underground.
Communism is like prohibition, it is a good idea, but it won't work.

Drug prohibition has caused gang warfare and other violent crimes by raising the prices of drugs so much that vicious criminals enter the market to make astronomical profits, and addicts rob and steal to get money to pay the inflated prices for their drugs.
As restrictions and prohibitions are multiplied the people grow poorer and poorer. When they are subjected to overmuch government, the land is thrown into confusion.
